itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday, September 24, 2013
contentencoded: The Russian government is privatizing gunmaker Kalashnikov, selling off its stake in the maker of the AK-47 rifle for about 40 million dollars. The BBC's Famil Ismailov joins Marketplace Morning Report host David Brancaccio to discuss.
title: Russia sells stake in maker of AK-47 rifle
description: The Kremlin is set to privatize a stake in one of its most well-known brands.
